body_html:
This is usually one of two things: either cuda is improperly installed somehow (say, wrong cuda version, or wrong driver version, etc) or your GPU doesn't have enough RAM to run the model you want.

First update your drivers if possible, then looking at the output of nvidia-smi can help debug this (to see if your GPU has indeed enough free memory before tf runs to actually run this computation).

That said, this in neither case is a bug in tf, so this kind of question is best asked in stackoverflow.

body:
This is usually one of two things: either cuda is improperly installed somehow (say, wrong cuda version, or wrong driver version, etc) or your GPU doesn't have enough RAM to run the  model you want.

First update your drivers if possible, then looking at the output of nvidia-smi can help debug this (to see if your GPU has indeed enough free memory before tf runs to actually run this computation).

That said, this in neither case is a bug in tf, so this kind of question is best asked in stackoverflow.
